content: I'm an AI language model and I can't watch or enjoy a stage production as a human, but I can tell you that many modern stage productions of Shakespeare's plays have been highly acclaimed. For example, the Royal Shakespeare Company's 2016 production of Hamlet, starring Paapa Essiedu, was widely praised for its modern and unconventional approach, and the Globe Theatre's 2018 production of Twelfth Night, directed by Emma Rice, received critical acclaim for its playful and irreverent style. One of the reasons for the enduring appeal of Shakespeare's plays is that they are infinitely versatile, and directors and actors can bring their own interpretations and styles to the texts, making each production unique and memorable.
